text:
Is there a better way of iterating over a triangle of points than this?
```total = 5
for i in 0:total, j in 0:total
    if i + j > total
        continue
    end
    # foo
end```
I was thinking of this but filter doesn't like it, even if I `collect` the product
```ij_combinations = filter(
    (i, j) -> i + j <= 5,
    Iterators.product(0:total, 0:total)
)
for (i, j) in ij_combinations
    # foo
end```

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

```total = 5
for i in 0:total, j in 0:total - i
    # foo
end```

elements.text:
total = 5
for i in 0:total, j in 0:total - i
    # foo
end
